intro: Linanthus aureus subsp. decorus, commonly known as the golden flax or decorative flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and native plant landscapes.
